task.name: isaaq10
task.string: Internet Severity and Activities Addiction Questionnaire, 10-items (ISAAQ-10)
Can you please answer the following questions about your internet use?
SEVERITY SCALE: QUESTIONS
SCALE
How often do you find yourself losing track of time while engaging in an internet-related activity?
How often do you use internet-related activities to block out disturbing thoughts about your life and to soothe yourself?
How often do you choose to spend time on internet-related activities to battle loneliness or boredom?
How often do you neglect your normal day-to-day activities to spend more time on an internet-related activity?
How often do your school/study suffer because of the amount of time you spend on internet-related activities?
How often do you find yourself trying to stop an excessive or repetitive online activity but feel an urge to continue
How often do you feel preoccupied with the internet when off-line, or fantasize or get repetitive urges to get on-line?
How often do you lose sleep due to late-night internet-related activities?
How often do you find yourself experiencing physical or psychological problems as a consequence of prolonged internet-related activities?
How often do you try to cut down the amount of time you spend on-line and fail?
Over the last 6 months, I have spent time on non-work or study related online activities such as:
INTERNET ACTIVITIES SCALE
General surfing (includes any unstructured online activities)
Internet gaming including Massively Multiplayer Online Role-Playing Games (includes online gaming and gaming with multiple other players and role-playing format)
Skill games and time-wasters (includes games and applications on computer, tablet, mobile phone or similar for which activity is without specific benefit)
Online shopping (includes activity on online shopping platforms and auction websites)
Online gambling (includes any online activity in which there is a chance for monetary gain or other stakes)
Social networking (includes browsing social media and messaging/communicating over online social platforms)
Health and medicine (includes any online activity relating to reading and researching medical facts, diagnoses, treatments and risks)
Pornography (includes cybersex, cyber-texting, viewing pornography and other online sexual activities)
Streaming media (includes music or video streaming activities on any platform)
Cyberbullying (includes exchange of insults, nasty texts/emails, unpleasant media, pranks)
Not at all
Rarely
Occasionally
Frequently
Very often
All the time
